title: Understanding Your Patterns
question: Why do you keep repeating the same patterns?
intro: Every person has a core fear that drives predictable strategies. The Enneagram maps nine personality structures, each pursuing different rewards to feel safe.
example: A Type 3 fears worthlessness and pursues achievement to prove their value. A Type 6 fears abandonment and pursues security. Understanding your type explains your triggers, not as character flaws, but as predictable patterns rooted in your core fear.
whyMatters: This depersonalizes your pattern. Instead of self-blame, you can observe your own protective strategy with compassion. You understand HOW you got here.

sections.heading: Three Centers of Intelligence
items: Head Center (Types 5, 6, 7): Driven by fear—constantly analyzing, trying to predict threat
Heart Center (Types 2, 3, 4): Driven by shame—seeking connection, worth, authenticity
Body Center (Types 8, 9, 1): Driven by anger—seeking power, peace, or perfection

sections.heading: What Each Type Reveals
items: Type 1: Core fear of being flawed; pursues perfection and righteousness
Type 2: Core fear of being unloved; pursues being needed and valued
Type 3: Core fear of worthlessness; pursues achievement and image
Type 4: Core fear of being ordinary; pursues authenticity and meaning
Type 5: Core fear of incompetence; pursues knowledge and understanding
Type 6: Core fear of abandonment; pursues loyalty and security
Type 7: Core fear of deprivation; pursues pleasure and stimulation
Type 8: Core fear of vulnerability; pursues control and justice
Type 9: Core fear of disconnection; pursues peace and harmony

title: Accessing Your Core Self
question: How do you actually transform the pattern?
intro: You're not one unified being—you're a system of "parts," each with good intentions but sometimes misdirected. At your core is the Self, your wise, compassionate center.
example: Your "Perfectionist" part is trying to protect a younger, wounded part that absorbed the message "You're only safe if you're flawless." The Perfectionist isn't the problem—it's a loyal protector. Once the young part feels safe and releases the old belief, the Perfectionist can relax.
whyMatters: This is how change actually happens. You access your Self-energy (characterized by calm, curiosity, compassion) and from that place, you help your protective parts trust that it's safe to be vulnerable. The nervous system responds to this felt safety.
learnMoreTitle: Learn more about internal parts and the Self

sections.heading: The Three Types of Parts
items: Managers (Proactive Protectors): These parts work BEFORE a trauma is triggered. Examples: Perfectionist, Inner Critic, People-Pleaser, Over-Achiever. They use control, planning, and vigilance to prevent exiles from being activated.

Firefighters (Reactive Protectors): These parts jump in AFTER an exile is triggered. Examples: Rage, Dissociation, Numbing through substances, Procrastination, Compulsive behaviors. Their strategy: whatever this painful feeling is, I'll do anything to make it stop—now.
Exiles (Wounded Parts): Young, vulnerable parts holding old trauma and painful beliefs. Protectors keep these parts hidden to prevent their pain from overwhelming your system.

sections.heading: The Self (Your True Center)
items: Calm: Unshakeable equanimity
Curiosity: Genuine interest without judgment
Compassion: Deep empathy for yourself and others
Confidence: Trust in your wisdom
Courage: Willingness to face what's difficult
Clarity: Clear seeing without distortion
Creativity: Access to new possibilities
Connection: Deep attunement to others

title: Rewiring Your Nervous System
question: How does your body learn it's safe to change?
intro: Patterns live in your nervous system, not just your mind. Your body holds trauma and old protective responses. We access this directly through somatic practices, breathwork, and embodied awareness.
example: That Perfectionist pattern creates chronic chest tension and shallow breathing. Your nervous system learned: "When you relax, bad things happen." Through breathwork and somatic awareness, your body experiences that it's actually SAFE to be calm. Your nervous system rewires.
whyMatters: Intellectual insight alone isn't enough. Your nervous system won't trust your mind's new beliefs. But when your body FEELS safety through regulation, transformation sticks.
learnMoreTitle: Learn more about nervous system states

sections.heading: The Three Nervous System States (Polyvagal Theory)
items: Ventral Vagal (Safe & Social) — The Healing State: Your nervous system is regulated, relaxed, and open. This is where all real transformation happens.
Sympathetic (Fight/Flight) — The Activated State: Your nervous system is in emergency mode. Chronically staying here leads to burnout and anxiety.
Dorsal Vagal (Freeze/Shutdown) — The Collapse State: Your nervous system has given up. Many people oscillate between Sympathetic and Dorsal Vagal.

sections.heading: Key Practices
items: Interoception — Learning to Feel from Within: Turn your awareness inward and notice subtle sensations
Theta State Access: Deep healing through guided somatic practices and breathwork
Equanimity to Sensation: Witness sensations with curious, compassionate awareness

title: Finding the Sacred Purpose
question: What is this pattern for? Why does this matter?
intro: Every pattern carries a hidden gift—a potential you're trying to express through a wounded lens. Your core wound is your raw material for genius.
example: Your compulsion to perform reveals your gift of total commitment. Once healed, you commit to what's TRUE, not what's performed. Your wound becomes your greatest strength.
whyMatters: Clients need meaning, not just symptom relief. This reframes the pattern from "fix me" to "what am I becoming?" It prevents relapse by showing the pattern's sacred purpose.
learnMoreTitle: Learn more about finding your purpose

sections.heading: The Three Frequencies of Every Gene Key
items: Shadow Frequency (Fear-Based): The wounded expression of this frequency. This is your core wound—the painful belief or pattern driving your survival strategies.
Gift Frequency (Creative Expression): The healed, creative expression of this same energy. When you move through your wound, the shadow transforms into your greatest strength.
Siddhi Frequency (Transcendent Realization): The highest expression—enlightened, compassionate, serving the collective.

sections.heading: Your Hologenetic Profile — Three Life Sequences
items: Life's Work (Activation Sequence): Your four primary archetypal gifts—your natural genius and what you're here to contribute.
Relationships (Venus Sequence): Your relational wounds and your path to opening your heart.
Prosperity (Pearl Sequence): Your path to true abundance through authentic service.
